medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset lower abdominal pain associated with malaise, nausea, and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient first felt malaise 2 days ago, which was associated with nausea and loose stools. Yesterday, lower abdominal pain developed, characterized as sharp and constant, nonradiating. Today, the pain migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and worsened. Patient experienced multiple episodes of nonbilious emesis and some subjective fevers and chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recent left ankle fracture, treated nonoperatively
